basic.description: CHEE 331, CHEE 332 and CHEE 333 share a core component that introduces the concept and approach to design in engineering practice, and the design and scaleup of unit operations and use of equilibrium stage concepts in process design. Emphasis will be placed on instrumentation, economics, safety and environmental responsibility. A major component of this course is a design project. Enrolment is restricted to students in the Engineering Chemistry Option.
basic.subject: CHEE
basic.title: Design of Unit Operations

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: CHEE 311, CHEE 321, CHEE 330, or permission of the department.  Corequisite: CHEE 360.  Must be registered in a BSCE academic program.
